department.dept_long_name: Division of Engineering and Applied Sciences

course.title: Visualization
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., 2:30–4, and a weekly section to be arranged
course.description: An introduction to key design principles and techniques for visualizing data. Covers design practices, data and image models, visual perception, interaction principles, visualization tools, and applications. Introduces programming of web-based interactive visualizations.
course.prerequisites: Students are expected to have basic programming experience (e.g., Computer Science 50).
course.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Empirical and Mathematical Reasoning.
